result.execSummary:
The defendant Devin J Chestnut was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: La Crosse County Clerk of Courts

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: On each count concurrent with same conditions also concurrent.

miscConds.notes: Restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the agent but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment.

Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random screenings.
.

Upon successful completion of all terms and conditions of probation, the record will be expunged under 973.015.
.

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendent in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.

  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by PO and follow through with any treatment recommendations.

Credit for 4 days if probation revoked.
.

ADDRESS INFO for Devin J Chestnut
Current: N3501 Hwy 35 Lot 210, Onalaska, WI 54650 United States  (Effective: 04-17-2015)
Prior: 1000 Copeland Ave., La Crosse, WI 54603

Def in court w/Atty Patricia L. O'Neil.  Jessica Skemp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM316
Ct. 1 - Retail theft - Guilty
Ct. 2 - Retail theft - Guilty
15CF189 - dismissed and read in
  Plea Quest filed/signed/understands
Understands const rights waived
Understands elements of crime
No promises/threats
No alc/drugs/meds in the last 24 hrs
  Plea is F, V & I made. Sufficient factual basis to support the plea and the def is found guilty.
Skemp: Only one prior for Para. But w/ the possession of meth, his drug use has escalated and he's in need of trmt
O'Neil: he lost his job at Burger King due to the meth case. They will take him back after 6 mos. 
Def: I am ready to be clean
Crt: I will add some com service hrs for rehabilitative than as a penalty since you aren't employed and it's healthy for you to do something positive in the community. 
SENTENCE:
Sentence withheld - 12 mos  probation
Cond:   Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.  Do not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from a licensed physician. Random testing; any other evals or programming deemed approp by PO and follow thru w/ any recommendations. Pay rest to Sears in the amt of $319.98 plus surcharge.  Perform  30  hrs com service. 4 days credit. Pay DOC fees & CC. 973.015 trmt upon successful  completion of probation.
